content: #15116 is a pretty big PR that replaces circle the submonoid with a new type Circle. It is pretty prone to merge conflicts and @Jireh Loreaux is happy with the idea at least. Anyone to review/approve?
I'd prefer if @Yury G. Kudryashov would weigh in, since I think this is used heavily in complex analysis. But if no one complains, I will merge it in a day or two.
Maybe also @David Loeffler or @Chris Birkbeck has an opinion?

I'm happy with this change overall – thanks Yael for working on this! I was a little concerned that this would make some computations using Circle lengthier, e.g. in Fourier transform computations; but looking at the PR, that evidently isn't the case – a lot of Submonoid.coe_smul's have become Circle.coe_smul, but that is a small net gain, rather than a loss. (I left one very minor remark.)
I'm happy with this! Thanks for doing it :)
It's bed time here, but I will get to your comment tomorrow first thing in the morning, David
Comment addressed and RFC tag removed :smile:
